div1.head: Letter from George Miller Sternberg to the Adjutant General, December 27, 1900
div1.opener:
Communications on official business should be addressed “To the Surgeon General, U. S. Army, Washington, D. C.”
Subject: Special Detail.
WAR DEPARTMENT,
In reply refer to No.
Surgeon General's Office,
Washington, December 27, 1900.
To the
ADJUTANT GENERAL OF THE ARMY.
Sir:
div1.p:
I have the honor to recommend that Major Walter Reed, Surgeon
U.S. Army, now in Havana, Cuba, may, in addition to the Medical
Officers named in paragraph 9, Special Orders 266, Adjutant
General's Office, November 12, 1900, be detailed to represent
the Medical Department of the Army at the Pan-American Medical
Congress to meet in the city of Havana, Cuba, February 5, 1901.
div1.closer: Very respectfully, G.M. Sternberg Surgeon General, U.S. Army.

div1.head: Special Orders #302, December 27, 1900
div1.p:
HEADQUARTERS OF THE ARMY,
ADJUTANT GENERAL'S OFFICE,
Washington, December 27, 1900.

21. By direction of the Secretary of War, Major Walter
Reed, surgeon, U. S. Army, is detailed to represent the Med-
ical Department of the Army at the Pan-American Medical
Congress to meet in the city of Havana, Cuba, February 5,
1901, in addition to the officers designated in paragraph 9,
Special Orders, No. 266, November 12, 1900, from this office.
BY COMMAND OF LIEUTENANT GENERAL MILES:
